author: Special Correspondent
text:
About 200 SC/ST students from various colleges in and around Erode benefitted from ‘Youth Conclave’, a skill-development programme organised recently at Vellalar College for Women (Autonomous) by Rajiv Gandhi National Institute of Youth Development (Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Government of India, Sriperumbudur, Tamilnadu).

The two-day programme encompassed sessions on ‘Sustainable development goals of UNO’, ‘Leadership and managerial skills’, ‘Non-verbal cues for honing effective business communication skills is a gateway to employability’, ‘Theatre skills in drama therapy’, ‘High risks behaviour among youth’, ‘Guidelines for UPSC / TNPSC exam preparation’, ‘Entrepreneurship and project proposals’, ‘Employability skills’ and ‘Emotional and mental health’, College Principal D. Kamalaveni said.

Addressing the participants, Superintendent of Police M.R. Sibi Chakravarthi spoke about how to deal with ethical dilemma with a sense of social responsibility while discharging duties in professional life.

He also explained the nuances of moral values, work ethics, honesty, courage, empathy, self-confidence and character building.
title: Skill development programme
